info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutherford, southern Cleveland, northeastern Spartanburg and Cherokee Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Gaffney, or 4 miles southwest of Boiling Springs NC, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Gaffney, Boiling Springs NC, Blacksburg, Mayo, Chesnee, Grover, Patterson Springs, Mooresboro and Earl. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
